name: nfded
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))
-| wnfc(s0, c2)
-| wi(w0, wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))
-| wnfc(s0, c2)
-| wi(w0, wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)))

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)), wnfc(s0, c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)))
-| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c1))
-| wi(wnfc(s0, c1), wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))
-| wnfc(s0, c2)
-| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c1))
-| wi(wnfc(s0, c1), wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wnfc(s0, c1), wb(wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, c0)))
-| wnf(s0, wnfc(s0, c1))
-| wi(wnfc(s0, c1), wceq(c2, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))
-| wnfc(s0, c2)
-| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c1))
-| wnf(s0, wnfc(s0, c1))
-| wi(wnfc(s0, c1), wceq(c2, c0))

|- wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))
-| wnfc(s0, c2)
-| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c1))
-| wi(wnfc(s0, c1), wceq(c2, c0))

comment: A deduction theorem that converts a not-free inference directly to deduction form. The first hypothesis is the hypothesis of the deduction form. The second is an equality deduction (e.g., ` ( F/_ x A -> U. { y | A. x y e. A } = U. A ) ` ) that starts from ~ abidnf . The last is assigned to the inference form (e.g., ` F/_ x U. { y | A. x y e. A } ` ) whose hypothesis is satisfied using ~ nfaba1 . (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2020.)
